snippet: Nurseries are finding the weather has depleted their stocks of colorful flowers and plants, and homeowners have discovered that their carefully tended backyards now look more like plant graveyards.
abstract: Freakishly cold Midwestern winter of 2014 has produced the most dismal start to spring in decades; nurseries are finding the weather has depleted their stocks of colorful flowers and plants, and homeowners have discovered that their carefully tended backyards now look more like plant graveyards.
lead_paragraph: Nurseries are finding the weather has depleted their stocks of colorful flowers and plants, and homeowners have discovered that their carefully tended backyards now look more like plant graveyards.

headline.main: Slow Exit of the Midwest’s Winter Buries Gardens in a Deep Freeze
headline.print_headline: Slow Exit of the Midwest’s Winter Buries Gardens in a Deep Freeze
